docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 10 A career diplomat whose outspoken public defense of human rights once brought him a rebuke from Henry A. Kissinger will probably head the first United States diplomatic mission to Cuba since the 1961 break in relations,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 10 A career diplomat whose outspoken public defense of human rights once brought him a rebuke from Henry A. Kissinger will probably head the first United States diplomatic mission to Cuba since the 1961 break in relations, Administration officials said today.
docs.abstract: State Sec Vance is expected to appt Robert E White to head US diplomatic mission to Cuba; former State Sec Kissinger's rebuke of White for White's public defense of human rights in Latin Amer during speech before OAS recalled; White por (M)

headline.main: Diplomat Whom Kissinger Chided May Head U.S. Mission in Havana

docs.snippet: EASTBOURNE, England, June 18-- The United States captured the women's Federation Cup in tennis for the sixth time today with a 2-1 victory over Australia in the final. For their efforts the American team of Billie Jean King, Chris Evert and Rosemary...
docs.lead_paragraph: EASTBOURNE, England, June 18-- The United States captured the women's Federation Cup in tennis for the sixth time today with a 2-1 victory over Australia in the final. For their efforts the American team of Billie Jean King, Chris Evert and Rosemary Casals collected more than $0,000 in prize money.

headline.main: U.S. Beats Aussies, 2-l, To Win Federation Cup

docs.lead_paragraph: ST. GEORGE'S, Grenada, June 19 (AP) United Stales diplomats hoping to win backing from Caribbean and Latin American nations campaigned behind the scenes, today for a strongly worded resolution on human rights by the General Assembly of the Organization of American States.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 22 The House Appropriations Committee, largely at the prodding of a middle-of-the-road Missouri Congressman, has voted to place restrictions on a secret contingency fund that the Central Intelligence Agency has, in the past, used to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 22 The House Appropriations Committee, largely at the prodding of a middle-of-the-road Missouri Congressman, has voted to place restrictions on a secret contingency fund that the Central Intelligence Agency has, in the past, used to initiate covert operations without the prior knowledge of Congress.

headline.main: Panel Backs Curb On C.I.A. Buildup Of a Secret Fund; Goal Is to Strengthen Congressional Role PANEL BACKS CURB ON C.I.A. BUILDUP
